page.title: 18Bradley Village Shop
page.content: The village shop is a small shop in the middle of the village,where they sell nearly everything you want,except clothes.They sell ice-creams and news papers,tights,eggs,crisps,vegetables, sweets,biscuits,toothbrushes,china, glass,and flowers.{and lots of other things}The shop opens at half past seven and closes at six.It is open every day.Most of the provisions are fetched by the owner from a big whole- salers.Special biscuits are delivered to the shop in a beautiful red van and the flowers come from the nursery.Two or three people work in the shop and use an electric till,which gives receipts.Part of the shop is a Post Office where Family Allowance and Pensions are paid,parcels weighed and stamps sold.The postman collects letters and parcels and puts them on a train to go to the sorting office.
